content.raw:
Just a heads up; I've been running with worlds generated using this, and I've twice now gotten odd behaviors in the habitat.  In the first one, I picked up the leak detector while having jumped to t3cp4, and had it nice and clear of the table, touching Val, and it never advanced to cp5.  In the second one, I picked up the leak repair tool while having jumped to t3cp6, and it also did not advance to 7.   The second one also had an odd message on the console (below), and when I picked up the repair tool, I got a very strange 'ghost' problem.  I'll attach a screen shot.  But, as far as gazebo was concerned, there was only one model, but you can clearly see the fingers grasping something else.  I'll attach a picture.

Also, for completeness, I'm using r608, with the patches from branch higher_array and plugin_sdf applied.

Here's the messages I saw on the console after jumping to t3/cp6:
[Msg] Task [3] - Checkpoint [6] - Started (15 419000000)
[Msg] Started box contains plugin [task3/checkpoint3]
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1807] Conversion of sensor type[logical_camera] not suppported.
[Err] [ContactManager.cc:284] Filter with the same name already exists! Aborting
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1807] Conversion of sensor type[logical_camera] not suppported.
[Err] [ContactManager.cc:284] Filter with the same name already exists! Aborting
[Err] [ContactManager.cc:284] Filter with the same name already exists! Aborting
[Err] [ContactManager.cc:284] Filter with the same name already exists! Aborting

Just a heads up; I've been running with worlds generated using this, and I've twice now gotten odd behaviors in the habitat. In the first one, I picked up the leak detector while having jumped to t3cp4, and had it nice and clear of the table, touching Val, and it never advanced to cp5. In the second one, I picked up the leak repair tool while having jumped to t3cp6, and it also did not advance to 7. The second one also had an odd message on the console (below), and when I picked up the repair tool, I got a very strange 'ghost' problem. I'll attach a screen shot. But, as far as gazebo was concerned, there was only one model, but you can clearly see the fingers grasping something else. I'll attach a picture.

Also, for completeness, I'm using r608, with the patches from branch higher_array and plugin_sdf applied.
